titleStmt.title: Die Martis, Iunii 24. 1645. It is this day ordered by the Commons assembled in Parliament that the ensignes and cornetts sent up now by Sir Thomas Fairfax, ... shall be brought into the Heralds office, ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons.

titleStmt.title: Die Martis, Iunii 24. 1645. It is this day ordered by the Commons assembled in Parliament that the ensignes and cornetts sent up now by Sir Thomas Fairfax, ... shall be brought into the Heralds office, ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Edward Husband, printer to the Honourable House of Commons,

notesStmt.note: Title from heading and first lines of text.
An order of Parliament that the ensignes and cornets sent up by Sir Thomas Fairfax are to be preserved in the Herald's office under the charge of William Ryley, Esq., Lancaster, Herald-at-Arms.
Signed: Hen. Elsynge, Cler. Parl. Dom. Com.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
